title: Drawing, Design for a Classical Temple with a Tempietto and Semicircular Aedicule, ca. 1780
title_raw: Design for a Classical Temple with a Tempietto and Semicircular Aedicule
medium: Pen and brush and black ink, gray wash, blue and brown watercolor, black chalk on heavy cream laid paper, double ruled border in pen and brush and black ink
markings: Cooper Union stamp in black, center verso:  Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower edge center:  Tempio Antico [erased]; lower edge, left: Scala di [followed by a scale], lower edge right:  Palmi Romi.
provenance:
Giovanni Piancastelli
Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: A circular domed temple, in plan and elevation, with four short wings and porticos on the axes.  Between the wings two columns resting on high base support an entablature above which,and aligned with the colums, are standing figures.  The round building sits inside a semi-circular two-storied structure with matching double columns and figures on the facade depicted.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for a Classical Temple with a Tempietto and Semicircular Aedicule, ca. 1780. Pen and brush and black ink, gray wash, blue and brown watercolor, black chalk on heavy cream laid paper, double ruled border in pen and brush and black ink. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7158
